title: What are some books that will keep anyone hooked? - Quora

response.answer_text: I agree with the individual who said “Catcher in the Rye” and I would add Vonnegut’s “God Bless You Mr. Rosewater, or Pearls Before Swine” and Joseph Heller’s “Catch 22;” John Irving’s books “The Word According to Garp,” “The Cider House Rules” and “A Prayer for Owen Meany,” and the New York Circle Book Award Winner “Motherless Brooklyn” and the Sean Duffy series by Adrian McKinty.

That depends so much on the individual reader! But most people who read the first Harry Potter book were 'hooked'. Perhaps you could check and see what book SERIES is successful and still bringing in readers over a long arc of books. Or look at best seller lists on the New York Times or USA Today.
